name: Viscum album
Relationship: Compare: SECALE; CONVALLAR.; BRY.; PULS.; RHODOD. GUIPSINE - active principle - (exalts the hypotensive properties of Viscum). HEDERA HELIX - Ivy - (Inter cranial pressure).

Heart: Hypertrophy with valvular insufficiency; pulse small and weak; unable to rest in a reclining positions
Weight and oppression of heart; as if a hand were squeezing it; ticking sensation about heart
Failing compensation, dyspnoea worse lying on left side
Head: Blue rings around eyes
Deafness from cold
Feeling as if whole vault of skull were lifted up
Buzzing and stopped-up feeling in ear
Facial muscles in constant agitation
Double vision
Persistent vertigo
Respiratory: Dyspnoea; feeling of suffocating when lying on left side
Asthma, if connected with gout or rheumatism
Female: Hemorrhage, with pain; blood partly clots and bright red
Pain from sacrum into pelvis, with tearing, shooting pains from above downwards
Extremities: Pains alternate in the knee and ankle with shoulder and elbow
Sensation of a spider crawling over back of hand and foot
General tremor, as if all muscles were in state of fibrillary contraction
Periodic pains from sacrum into pelvis, worse in bed, with pains into thighs and upper extremities
Tearing, shooting pains in both thighs and upper extremities
A glow rises from the feet to the head; seems to be on fire

details: Lowered blood pressure. Dilated blood vessels but does not act on the centers in the medulla. Pulse is slow due to central irritation of the vagus. The symptoms point especially to rheumatic and gouty complaints; neuralgia, especially sciatica. Epilepsy, CHOREA, and metrorrhagia. RHEUMATIC DEAFNESS. ASTHMA. Spinal pains, due to uterine causes. Rheumatism with TEARING PAINS. Hypertensive albuminuria. Valvular disease, with disturbances in sexual sphere. Symptoms like epileptic aura and petit mal.
